Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him

2.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
Kerioth, the name of two places in Palestine
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
uproar (as of rushing); by implication, destruction
Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
clamor, i.e. acclamation of joy or a battle-cry; especially clangorof trumpets, as an alarum
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn

3.brief: to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a head person (of any rank or class)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

to say (used with great latitude)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
three; occasionally (ordinal) third, or (multiple) thrice
a revolt (national, moral or religious)

who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)

Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to sell, literally (as merchandise, a daughter in marriage, into slavery), or figuratively (to surrender)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
properly, crossed, i.e. (abstractly) transit; used only adverbially, on account of, in order that
properly, a sandal tongue; by extension a sandal or slipper (sometimes as a symbol of occupancy, a refusal to marry, or of something valueless)

7.brief: to inhale eagerly; figuratively, to cover; by implication, to be angry; also to hasten
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
properly, to bore, i.e. (by implication) to wound, to dissolve; figuratively, to profane (a person, place or thing), to break (one's word), to begin (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to play (the flute)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to urge; by implication, to inflict apenalty, specifically, to fine
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

an Emorite, one of the Canaanitish tribes
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a cedar tree (from the tenacity of its roots)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, the upper part, used only adverbially with prefix upward, above, overhead, from the top, etc.
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
an Emorite, one of the Canaanitish tribes

meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
something revolving, i.e. a wheeled vehicle

strong (usu. in a bad sense, hard, bold, violent)

properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to flit, i.e. vanish away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver)
